articles.title: Local obituary: Henry Oberlander, 29, standout wrestler at Xaverian Brothers and Bridgewater State

summary: Henry Oberlander, 29, passed away, remembered for his wrestling achievements at Xaverian Brothers.

His family emphasized his love for gatherings, impacting community connections in Boston.

articles.title: Supreme Court rejects call to overturn its decision legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide
articles.description:
The justices turned away an appeal from Kim Davis, the former Kentucky court clerk who refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples after the high court's 2015 ruling in Obergefell v. Hodges.

The post Supreme Court rejects call to overturn its decision legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Supreme Court upheld 2015 ruling legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide on November 10, 2025.
Kim Davis' appeal to overturn Obergefell v. Hodges was rejected by the justices.
Boston residents continue to benefit from the legal recognition of same-sex marriages.

articles.title: Flight cancellations and delays worsen as government shutdown drags on
articles.description:

summary: Nearly 1,600 flights canceled on Monday due to ongoing government shutdown.

articles.title: What’s in the legislation to end the federal government shutdown
articles.description:
The Senate could wrap up passage as soon as Monday. The bill cleared a procedural hurdle, 60-40, late Sunday, with eight Democrats joining most Republicans.

The post What’s in the legislation to end the federal government shutdown appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Senate could finalize government shutdown legislation by Monday, impacting federal services in Boston.
Bill passed a procedural hurdle with a 60-40 vote, including support from eight Democrats.
Local businesses and residents rely on federal funding, which could resume with the bill's passage.
